A Hat to Remember

A young man clutches his worn-out hat.  
He feels a wave of terror.  
“I knew it! This hat is too noticeable!”  

---  

He walks, counting his steps nervously.  
“Seven hundred thirty steps to my door.”  
“Trifles ruin everything… I can’t be remembered!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man is consumed by anxiety over his conspicuous hat, fearing it could jeopardize his carefully planned actions.
